snippet: The number of people with dementia and the cost of caring for them are skyrocketing at a rate that rarely occurs with a chronic disease, a new study suggests.
abstract: Study published in New England Journal of Medicine finds that financial burden of caring for patients with dementia is at least as high as that of heart disease or cancers, and probably higher; finds that both costs and number of Americans with dementia will more than double within 30 years, skyrocketing at rate that rarely occurs with chronic disease.
lead_paragraph: The number of people with dementia and the cost of caring for them are skyrocketing at a rate that rarely occurs with a chronic disease, a new study suggests.

headline.seo: Dementia Care Costs Are Soaring, Study Finds
headline.main: Dementia Care Cost Is Projected to Double by 2040
headline.print_headline: Dementia Study Predicts A Surge In Cost And Cases
